gameCore
Class Tile

java.lang.Object
  gameCore.Tile

public class Tile
extends java.lang.Object

A Tile is the minimal unit in the game. They have a location and edges. It can contain items (in the form of an inventory) and a character. A Tile can look at adjacent tiles, but no farther (relative to the public API anyways).

Version:
1.0
Author:
Group D, Main author: Darrell Penner Group D Members --------------- Karen Madore Trang Pham Darrell Penner

isCrossable

public boolean isCrossable(java.lang.String direction)
                    throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Checks whether the edge in the given direction is crossable by the character in the tile

Parameters:
direction - The direction of desired crossing
Returns:
True if the edge is crossable, false otherwise
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - When this method is called when there is no character standing on the tile

canMove

public boolean canMove(java.lang.String direction)
Can only move if capable of crossing the edge, and another character is not currently occupying the destination tile.

Parameters:
direction - The direction of possible movement
Returns:
whether or not the character can move in that direction

Parameters:

Returns:
The new tile of the character
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the player cannot move in the given direction. Try calling canMove(direction) first.
